byline.contributor: Prashant Rao contributed reporting from London.

abstract: Greece, which remains main European entry route for asylum seekers, is left handling brunt of migrant crisis while trying to enact austerity measures demanded by European Union; Greek Prime Min Alexis Tsipras may be able to leverage situation to ease debt burden.

headline.print_headline: Migrant Crisis Alters European Union Calculations for a Greece That Still Struggles
headline.main: Migrant Crisis Alters E.U. Calculations for Greece as Its Debt Struggle Continues

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Eight months after Greece agreed to more austerity measures as part of a bailout, it has largely been left to fend for itself on asylum seekers.
lead_paragraph: Eight months after Greece agreed to more austerity measures as part of a bailout, it has largely been left to fend for itself on asylum seekers.
